The six qualities of a mendicant worthy: When they see a sight with their eyes, they are neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
When they hear a sound with their ears, they are neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
When they smell an odor with their nose, they are neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
When they taste a flavor with their tongue, they are neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
When they feel a touch with their body, they are neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
When they know a thought with their mind, they are neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
